title: Find the Best Flights
text: R package analyzing, forecasting, collecting flight data prices Google Flights.

title: Find the Best Flights
text: Detailed scraping querying tools Google Flights using chromote Support multiple trip types: one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain Flexible date search across multiple airports date ranges Summary tables showing prices city date Automatic identification cheapest travel dates Visualization functions price trends best dates

title: Find the Best Flights
text: can install development version flightanalysis GitHub:
code: install.packages('flightanalysis',    repos = c('https://rempsyc.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org'))  # Or if you need the version from the last hour, install through `remotes` # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("rempsyc/flightanalysis")

what: Creating Flight Queries and Fetching the Data
title: Find the Best Flights
text: main scraping function makes backbone functionalities fa_define_query(). serves data object, preserving flight information well meta-data query. fa_fetch_flights() fetches flight information query. Origin destination airports can specified mix Airport 3-letter codes, city 3-letter codes, city names. package supports multiple trip types: One-way: fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-07-20") Round-trip: fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-07-20", "2025-08-20") Chain-trip: fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-08-20", "RDU", "LGA", "2025-12-25") Perfect-chain: fa_define_query("JFK", "2025-09-20", "IST", "2025-09-25", "JFK")
code: # Round-trip query <- fa_define_query("NYC", "London", "2025-12-20", "2026-01-05")  # Same as: query <- fa_define_query("New York", "LON", "2025-12-20", "2026-01-05") query #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: NYC --> LON #> 2026-01-05: LON --> NYC #> )  # Fetch the flight data flights <- fa_fetch_flights(query) #>   Segment 1/2: NYC -> LON on 2025-12-20 #>   [OK] Successfully parsed 7 flights #>   Segment 2/2: LON -> NYC on 2026-01-05 #>   [OK] Successfully parsed 18 flights #>   [OK] Total flights retrieved: 25  # View the flight data head(flights$data[1:11]) |>   knitr::kable()

title: Find the Best Flights
text: package supports flexible date search across multiple airports dates:
code: # Create query objects for multiple origins and dates queries <- fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-22" )  # Fetch all flights flights <- fa_fetch_flights(queries, verbose = FALSE)  # Create summary table (City × Date with prices) fa_summarize_prices(flights) |>   knitr::kable() # Find the cheapest dates fa_find_best_dates(   flights,    n = 5,   by = "min",   price_max = 1400,   max_stops = 1,   travel_time_max = 26  # 26 hours (numeric = hours, or use "26 hr" format)   ) |>   knitr::kable()

title: Find the Best Flights
text: package includes plotting functions visualize price trends best dates:
code: # Plot price trends across dates fa_plot_prices(flights,                 title = "Flight Prices: BOM/DEL to JFK",                size_by = "travel_time",                annotate_col = "travel_time") # Plot best travel dates fa_plot_best_dates(flights)

title: Find the Best Flights
text: Credits: package R implementation inspired original Python package google-flight-analysis Kaya Celebi.

title: Create Flight Results Object — create_flight_results

title: Create Flight Results Object — create_flight_results
text: queries Named list flight_query objects

title: Create Flight Results Object — create_flight_results

what: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
title: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes

title: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
text: flight_results single query object, flight_results object, named list query objects

title: Extract and Process Data from Query Objects — extract_data_from_scrapes
text: data frame columns: Airport, Date, Price, City (named list),   additional columns: departure_datetime, airlines, travel_time, num_stops,   layover, co2_emission_kg (available)

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
text: Defines flight query Google Flights. Supports one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain trip types. Accepts airport codes (e.g., "JFK", "LGA"), city codes (e.g., "NYC" New York City airports), full city names (e.g., "New York"). Full city names automatically converted first associated airport code. Common city codes include: "NYC" (New York), "LON" (London), "PAR" (Paris), "TYO" (Tokyo), "BUE" (Buenos Aires), etc.

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
text: ... Arguments defining trip. Locations can 3-letter codes full city names. Format depends trip type: - One-way: origin, dest, date - Round-trip: origin, dest, date_leave, date_return - Chain-trip: org1, dest1, date1, org2, dest2, date2, ... - Perfect-chain: org1, date1, org2, date2, ..., final_dest

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
text: flight query object (S3 class "flight_query")

title: Define Flight Query — fa_define_query
code: # One-way trip with airport codes fa_define_query("JFK", "BOS", "2025-12-20") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> BOS #> )  # One-way trip with city codes fa_define_query("NYC", "LON", "2025-12-20") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: NYC --> LON #> )  # One-way trip with full city names (auto-converted) fa_define_query("New York", "Istanbul", "2025-12-20") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: NYC --> IST #> )  # Round-trip with mixed formats fa_define_query("JFK", "Paris", "2025-12-20", "2025-12-25") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> PAR #> 2025-12-25: PAR --> JFK #> )  # Chain-trip fa_define_query("JFK", "YYZ", "2025-12-20", "RDU", "LGA", "2025-12-25") #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> YYZ #> 2025-12-25: RDU --> LGA #> )

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
text: Creates flight queries multiple origin airports/cities across date range. helper function generates permutations origins dates without actually fetching data. origin gets query object. Similar fa_define_query date ranges. Supports airport codes (e.g., "JFK", "LGA"), city codes (e.g., "NYC" New York City airports), full city names (e.g., "New York"). Full city names automatically converted associated airport codes (excluding heliports). can mix formats vector.

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
text: origin Character vector airport codes, city codes, full city names search . Can mix formats (e.g., c("JFK", "NYC", "New York")). Automatically expands city names associated airports (excluding heliports) removes duplicates. dest Character destination airport code, city code, full city name. city name expands multiple airports, first airport used. Currently single destination supported. date_min Character Date. Start date "YYYY-MM-DD" format. date_max Character Date. End date "YYYY-MM-DD" format.

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
text: single origin: flight query object containing dates.   multiple origins: named list flight query objects, one per origin.

title: Define Flight Query Range — fa_define_query_range
code: # Airport codes fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-20" ) #> $BOM #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: BOM --> JFK #> ) #> $DEL #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: DEL --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: DEL --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: DEL --> JFK #> )  # City codes fa_define_query_range(   origin = "NYC",   dest = "LON",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-20" ) #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: NYC --> LON #> 2025-12-19: NYC --> LON #> 2025-12-20: NYC --> LON #> )  # Full city names (auto-converted to airport codes) fa_define_query_range(   origin = "New York",   dest = "Istanbul",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-20" ) #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: NYC --> IST #> 2025-12-19: NYC --> IST #> 2025-12-20: NYC --> IST #> )  # Mix formats - codes and city names fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("New York", "JFK", "BOM", "Patna"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-20" ) #> $NYC #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: NYC --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: NYC --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: NYC --> JFK #> ) #> $JFK #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: JFK --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: JFK --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: JFK --> JFK #> ) #> $BOM #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: BOM --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: BOM --> JFK #> ) #> $PAT #> Flight Query( {Not Yet Fetched} #> 2025-12-18: PAT --> JFK #> 2025-12-19: PAT --> JFK #> 2025-12-20: PAT --> JFK #> )

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
text: Fetches flight data Google Flights using chromote. function automatically set Chrome browser connection, navigate Google Flights URLs, extract flight information. Uses Chrome DevTools Protocol reliable, driver-free browser automation. browser runs headless mode default (visible GUI).

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
text: queries flight query object list query objects (fa_define_query()) verbose Logical. TRUE, shows detailed progress information (default)

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
text: flight_results object containing merged flight data.   Access data via `result$data`. **Important:** must capture   return value get flight data: `result <- fa_fetch_flights(query)`

title: Fetch Flight Data — fa_fetch_flights
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ query <- fa_define_query("NYC", "IST", "2025-12-20", "2025-12-22") flights <- fa_fetch_flights(query) flights$data } # }

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
text: Identifies returns top N dates cheapest average prices across routes. helps quickly identify best travel dates planning flexible trip. Supports filtering various criteria departure time, airlines, travel time, stops, emissions.

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
code: fa_find_best_dates(   flight_results,   n = 10,   by = "min",   time_min = NULL,   time_max = NULL,   airlines = NULL,   price_min = NULL,   price_max = NULL,   travel_time_max = NULL,   max_stops = NULL,   max_layover = NULL,   max_emissions = NULL,   excluded_airports = NULL )

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
text: flight_results flight_results object fa_fetch_flights(). function longer accepts data frames query objects directly. n Integer. Number best dates return. Default 10. Character. calculate best dates: "mean" (average price across routes), "median", "min" (lowest price date). Default "min". time_min Character. Minimum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). time_max Character. Maximum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). airlines Character vector. Filter specific airlines. Default NULL (filter). price_min Numeric. Minimum price. Default NULL (filter). price_max Numeric. Maximum price. Default NULL (filter). travel_time_max Numeric character. Maximum travel time. numeric, interpreted hours. character, use format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_stops Integer. Maximum number stops. Default NULL (filter). max_layover Character. Maximum layover time format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_emissions Numeric. Maximum CO2 emissions kg. Default NULL (filter). excluded_airports Character vector. Airport codes exclude results. Default NULL (additional filtering beyond global excluded_airports list).

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
text: data frame columns: departure_date, departure_time (date datetime available),   origin, price (average/median/min), n_routes, num_stops, layover,   travel_time, co2_emission_kg, airlines, arrival_date, arrival_time. column names lowercase.   Returns top N dates best (lowest) prices, sorted departure time display.   Additional columns aggregated using mean/median numeric values common value categorical.   Note: arrival_date arrival_time represent common values multiple flights aggregated   may correspond exactly specific departure times shown.

title: Find Best Travel Dates — fa_find_best_dates
code: # Find best dates fa_find_best_dates(sample_flight_results, n = 3, by = "min") #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin price #> 1     2025-12-18          08:00   2025-12-18        19:00    DEL   564 #> 2     2025-12-22          08:00   2025-12-22        08:30    DEL   541 #> 3     2026-01-05          07:00   2026-01-05        11:45    DEL   567 #>   num_stops         layover  travel_time co2_emission_kg airlines n_routes #> 1         1 5 hr 15 min FRA 16 hr 46 min             923   United        1 #> 2         2 4 hr 30 min DXB 15 hr 55 min             882   United        2 #> 3         1 3 hr 45 min IST 16 hr 44 min             895   United        1  # With filters fa_find_best_dates(   sample_flight_results,   n = 2,   max_stops = 0 ) #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin price #> 1     2026-01-04          14:00   2026-01-04        10:30    BOM   615 #> 2     2026-01-05          12:45   2026-01-05        14:45    BOM   618 #>   num_stops  travel_time co2_emission_kg  airlines n_routes #> 1         0 15 hr 35 min             885 Lufthansa        1 #> 2         0 16 hr 10 min             871    United        1

title: Plot Best Travel Dates — fa_plot_best_dates
text: Creates modern visualization showing best (cheapest) travel dates identified fa_find_best_dates. Uses lollipop chart style clearly shows price range highlights best options origin date. Uses ggplot2 polished, publication-ready aesthetic colorblind-friendly colors clear typography.

title: Plot Best Travel Dates — fa_plot_best_dates
code: fa_plot_best_dates(   flight_results,   title = "Best Travel Dates by Price",   subtitle = NULL,   x_axis_angle = 0,   ... )

title: Plot Best Travel Dates — fa_plot_best_dates
text: flight_results flight_results object [fa_fetch_flights()]. title Character. Plot title. Default "Best Travel Dates Price". subtitle Character. Plot subtitle. Default NULL (auto-generated). x_axis_angle Numeric. Angle degrees rotate x-axis labels better readability wide figures many dates. Common values 45 (diagonal) 90 (vertical). Default 0 (horizontal labels). ... Additional arguments passed fa_find_best_dates best_dates flight_results object, including excluded_airports filter specific airport codes.

title: Plot Best Travel Dates — fa_plot_best_dates
text: ggplot2 plot object can customized saved.

title: Plot Best Travel Dates — fa_plot_best_dates
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Plot best dates fa_plot_best_dates(sample_flight_results, n = 5)  # With filters fa_plot_best_dates(sample_flight_results, n = 5, max_stops = 0)  # Tilt x-axis labels diagonally for wide figures fa_plot_best_dates(sample_flight_results, n = 10, x_axis_angle = 45) } # }

title: Plot Price Summary — fa_plot_prices
text: Creates modern line plot showing price trends across dates different origins/cities. Requires flight_results objects fa_fetch_flights. function longer accepts pre-summarized data data frames. Uses ggplot2 polished, publication-ready aesthetic colorblind-friendly colors clear typography.

title: Plot Price Summary — fa_plot_prices
code: fa_plot_prices(   flight_results,   title = NULL,   subtitle = NULL,   size_by = NULL,   annotate_col = NULL,   use_ggrepel = TRUE,   show_max_annotation = TRUE,   show_min_annotation = FALSE,   x_axis_angle = 0,   drop_empty_dates = TRUE,   ... )

title: Plot Price Summary — fa_plot_prices
text: flight_results flight_results object [fa_fetch_flights()]. title Character. Plot title. Default NULL (auto-generated flight context). subtitle Character. Plot subtitle. Default NULL (auto-generated lowest price info). size_by Character. Name column raw flight data use point sizing. Can "price", column name like "travel_time", NULL uniform sizing (default). using column name, works passing raw flight data, summary tables. Default NULL. annotate_col Character. Name column raw flight data use point annotations (e.g., "travel_time", "num_stops"). works passing raw flight data, summary tables. Default NULL (annotations). use_ggrepel Logical. TRUE, uses ggrepel non-overlapping label positioning (requires ggrepel package). FALSE, labels centered points may overlap many data points. Default TRUE. show_max_annotation Logical. TRUE, adds data-journalism-style annotation maximum price horizontal bar formatted price label. annotation subtle clean (arrows boxes). Default TRUE. show_min_annotation Logical. TRUE, adds data-journalism-style annotation minimum price horizontal bar formatted price label. annotation subtle clean (arrows boxes). Default FALSE. x_axis_angle Numeric. Angle degrees rotate x-axis labels better readability wide figures many dates. Common values 45 (diagonal) 90 (vertical). Default 0 (horizontal labels). drop_empty_dates Logical. TRUE, removes dates flight data (NA prices) plot. useful querying multiple airports may data certain dates. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed fa_summarize_prices, including excluded_airports filter specific airport codes.

title: Plot Price Summary — fa_plot_prices
text: ggplot2 plot object can customized saved.

title: Plot Price Summary — fa_plot_prices
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Basic plot with auto-generated title and subtitle fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results)  # With point size based on travel time and annotations fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results,                size_by = "travel_time",                annotate_col = "num_stops")  # Size by number of stops fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results,                size_by = "num_stops")  # With annotations centered on points (no ggrepel) fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results,                size_by = "travel_time",                annotate_col = "travel_time",                use_ggrepel = FALSE)  # Custom title and both price annotations fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results,                title = "Custom Title",                show_max_annotation = TRUE,                show_min_annotation = TRUE)  # Tilt x-axis labels diagonally for wide figures fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results, x_axis_angle = 45)  # Default behavior: filter out dates with no flight data # Set drop_empty_dates = FALSE to keep all dates including empty ones fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results, drop_empty_dates = FALSE) } # }

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
text: Creates wide summary table showing prices city/airport date, average price column. multiple flights exist date, uses minimum (cheapest) price. useful visualizing price patterns across multiple dates comparing different origin airports. Supports filtering various criteria departure time, airlines, travel time, stops, emissions.

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
code: fa_summarize_prices(   flight_results,   include_comment = TRUE,   currency_symbol = "$",   round_prices = TRUE,   time_min = NULL,   time_max = NULL,   airlines = NULL,   price_min = NULL,   price_max = NULL,   travel_time_max = NULL,   max_stops = NULL,   max_layover = NULL,   max_emissions = NULL,   excluded_airports = NULL )

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
text: flight_results flight_results object [fa_fetch_flights()]. include_comment Logical. TRUE Comment column exists, includes output. Default TRUE. currency_symbol Character. Currency symbol use formatting. Default "$". round_prices Logical. TRUE, rounds prices nearest integer. Default TRUE. time_min Character. Minimum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). time_max Character. Maximum departure time "HH:MM" format (24-hour). Filters flights departing time. Default NULL (filter). airlines Character vector. Filter specific airlines. Default NULL (filter). price_min Numeric. Minimum price. Default NULL (filter). price_max Numeric. Maximum price. Default NULL (filter). travel_time_max Numeric character. Maximum travel time. numeric, interpreted hours. character, use format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_stops Integer. Maximum number stops. Default NULL (filter). max_layover Character. Maximum layover time format "XX hr XX min". Default NULL (filter). max_emissions Numeric. Maximum CO2 emissions kg. Default NULL (filter). excluded_airports Character vector. Airport codes exclude results. Default NULL (additional filtering beyond global excluded_airports list).

title: Create Price Summary Table — fa_summarize_prices
text: wide data frame columns: City, Origin, Comment (optional),   one column per date prices, Average_Price column.

what: flightanalysis: Find the Best Flights — flightanalysis-package
title: flightanalysis: Find the Best Flights — flightanalysis-package
text: Tools models users analyze, forecast, collect data regarding flights prices. Features include detailed scraping querying tools Google Flights. package provides tools models users analyze, forecast, collect data regarding flights prices. Current features include: Detailed scraping querying tools Google Flights Support multiple trip types (one-way, round-trip, chain, perfect-chain) Flexible date search across multiple airports date ranges Summary tables best date identification travel planning Base analytical tools/methods price forecasting/summary

title: flightanalysis: Find the Best Flights — flightanalysis-package
text: fa_define_query Create flight query object fa_fetch_flights Execute flight queries (requires chromote) fa_define_query_range Create queries flexible date search fa_summarize_prices Create wide summary table price comparison fa_find_best_dates Identify cheapest travel dates

title: flightanalysis: Find the Best Flights — flightanalysis-package
text: package supports multiple trip types: One-way: Single flight origin destination Round-trip: Flight destination return Chain-trip: Sequence unrelated one-way flights Perfect-chain: Sequence destination becomes next origin

title: flightanalysis: Find the Best Flights — flightanalysis-package
text: Maintainer: Rémi Thériault remi.theriault@mail.mcgill.ca (ORCID) Authors: Kaya Celebi kayacelebi17@gmail.com

Normalize Location Codes — normalize_location_codes
text: Internal function normalize mix airport codes, city codes, full city names standardized 3-letter codes. Automatically converts full city names metropolitan area codes available (unless expand_cities=TRUE), otherwise individual airport codes.

title: Normalize Location Codes — normalize_location_codes
text: locations Character vector mixed airport codes, city codes, city names expand_cities Logical. TRUE, expands city names individual airports. FALSE (default), uses metropolitan area codes available.

title: Sample Flight Results Dataset — sample_flight_results
text: comprehensive sample dataset containing flight data 5 Indian origins (BOM, DEL, VNS, PAT, GAY) JFK spanning December 18, 2025 January 5, 2026. dataset demonstrates realistic pricing patterns including Christmas/New Year price spike, making ideal testing demonstrating flight analysis functions.

title: Sample Flight Results Dataset — sample_flight_results
text: flight_results object (S3 class) following structure: data data frame 95 rows (5 origins × 19 days) containing: departure_date: Character, departure date "YYYY-MM-DD" format departure_time: Character, departure time "HH:MM" format arrival_date: Character, arrival date "YYYY-MM-DD" format arrival_time: Character, arrival time "HH:MM" format origin: Character, origin airport code (BOM, DEL, VNS, PAT, GAY) destination: Character, destination airport code (JFK) airlines: Character, airline name travel_time: Character, total travel time "XX hr YY min" format price: Numeric, ticket price USD num_stops: Integer, number stops (0-2) layover: Character, layover information (applicable) access_date: Character, timestamp data accessed co2_emission_kg: Numeric, estimated CO2 emissions kg emission_diff_pct: Numeric, emission difference percentage  BOM, DEL, VNS, PAT, GAY Query objects origin containing     data subset query parameters

title: Sample Flight Results Dataset — sample_flight_results
text: dataset features: Realistic travel times varying origin (15.5-18.5 hours) Base prices varying origin ($580-$700) Christmas/New Year price spike (Dec 23 - Jan 3) 1.3x-4.5x multiplier Peak prices around January 1-2 Weekend price adjustments (10% increase) Random variation simulate real-world data dataset particularly useful : Demonstrating fa_plot_prices seasonal patterns Testing fa_summarize_prices multiple origins Showing fa_find_best_dates functionality Creating visually appealing examples size_by parameter

title: Sample Flight Results Dataset — sample_flight_results
code: # Load and examine the dataset head(sample_flight_results$data) #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin destination #> 1     2025-12-18          08:15   2025-12-18        16:00    BOM         JFK #> 2     2025-12-19          14:00   2025-12-19        08:45    BOM         JFK #> 3     2025-12-20          17:30   2025-12-20        15:00    BOM         JFK #> 4     2025-12-21          11:00   2025-12-21        07:00    BOM         JFK #> 5     2025-12-22          20:00   2025-12-22        20:15    BOM         JFK #> 6     2025-12-23          21:00   2025-12-23        22:15    BOM         JFK #>           airlines  travel_time price num_stops         layover #> 1         Emirates 15 hr 25 min   624         1 3 hr 15 min FRA #> 2           United  15 hr 3 min   587         1 4 hr 15 min FRA #> 3        Air India  15 hr 2 min   658         0            <NA> #> 4 Turkish Airlines 16 hr 17 min   609         1 5 hr 45 min DXB #> 5         Emirates 16 hr 13 min   625         1 4 hr 45 min IST #> 6         Emirates 16 hr 10 min   679         2  2 hr 0 min LHR #>           access_date co2_emission_kg emission_diff_pct #> 1 2025-11-16 16:19:56             838              -0.1 #> 2 2025-11-16 16:19:56             878              10.9 #> 3 2025-11-16 16:19:56             837               0.3 #> 4 2025-11-16 16:19:56             907              11.2 #> 5 2025-11-16 16:19:56             873               3.4 #> 6 2025-11-16 16:19:56             884               7.0  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Plot with automatic Christmas spike visualization fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results)  # Size points by travel time fa_plot_prices(sample_flight_results, size_by = "travel_time")  # Create price summary table fa_summarize_prices(sample_flight_results)  # Find best dates fa_find_best_dates(sample_flight_results, n = 5) } # }

title: Sample Flight Data — sample_flights
text: Sample flight data testing analysis functions like `fa_find_best_dates()` `fa_summarize_prices()` without internet access.

title: Sample Flight Data — sample_flights
text: data frame 6 rows 14 variables: departure_date Character, departure date (YYYY-MM-DD) departure_time Character, departure time (HH:MM) arrival_date Character, arrival date (YYYY-MM-DD) arrival_time Character, arrival time (HH:MM) origin Character, 3-letter origin airport code destination Character, 3-letter destination airport code airlines Character, airline name(s) travel_time Character, total travel time price Numeric, ticket price USD num_stops Integer, number stops layover Character, layover details (NA nonstop) access_date Character, data accessed co2_emission_kg Numeric, CO2 emissions kg emission_diff_pct Numeric, emission difference percentage

title: Sample Flight Data — sample_flights
code: head(sample_flights) #>   departure_date departure_time arrival_date arrival_time origin destination #> 1     2025-12-20          09:00   2025-12-20        22:00    JFK         IST #> 2     2025-12-20          14:30   2025-12-21        03:45    JFK         IST #> 3     2025-12-20          22:00   2025-12-21        11:30    JFK         IST #> 4     2025-12-21          10:15   2025-12-21        23:30    JFK         IST #> 5     2025-12-27          08:30   2025-12-27        21:15    IST         JFK #> 6     2025-12-27          15:45   2025-12-28        05:00    IST         JFK #>              airlines  travel_time price num_stops         layover #> 1    Turkish Airlines  13 hr 0 min   650         0            <NA> #> 2           Lufthansa 13 hr 15 min   720         1 2 hr 30 min FRA #> 3 LOT Polish Airlines 13 hr 30 min   580         1 3 hr 15 min WAW #> 4          Air France 13 hr 15 min   695         1 2 hr 45 min CDG #> 5    Turkish Airlines 12 hr 45 min   620         0            <NA> #> 6     United Airlines 13 hr 15 min   685         1 3 hr 10 min EWR #>           access_date co2_emission_kg emission_diff_pct #> 1 2025-11-16 16:19:56             550                 5 #> 2 2025-11-16 16:19:56             580                10 #> 3 2025-11-16 16:19:56             600                15 #> 4 2025-11-16 16:19:56             570                 8 #> 5 2025-11-16 16:19:56             540                 3 #> 6 2025-11-16 16:19:56             575                 9  # Note: sample_flights is a data frame for demonstration purposes only. # Analysis functions now require flight_results objects from fa_fetch_flights(). # Use sample_flight_results instead: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ fa_find_best_dates(sample_flight_results, n = 3) fa_summarize_prices(sample_flight_results) } # }

title: flightanalysis 3.0.0 (Development)
text: Removed support direct data frame input Removed support query object list query objects input Users must use fa_fetch_flights() create flight_results objects using analysis functions Clear error messages guide users correct workflow

title: flightanalysis 3.0.0 (Development)
text: change simplifies API enforcing consistent workflow: 1. Create queries fa_define_query() fa_define_query_range() 2. Fetch data fa_fetch_flights() get flight_results objects 3. Analyze data processing functions

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0
text: Function Rename: fa_create_date_range() renamed fa_define_query_range() consistency fa_define_query(). old function removed.

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0
text: Contains merged $data field flight data accessible directly Preserves individual query objects named elements (e.g., $BOM, $DEL) dedicated print method better display

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0
text: Parameter Renaming: fa_summarize_prices() fa_find_best_dates() now use flight_results parameter name instead results clarity type safety Improved Documentation: Updated examples documentation use new function names Better Data Access: need manually merge data multiple origins - access unified data via flights$data directly

title: flightanalysis 2.1.0
code: # Create queries for multiple origins queries <- fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2025-12-22" )  # Fetch data - returns flight_results object with merged data flights <- fa_fetch_flights(queries)  # Access merged data directly flights$data  # Or access individual origin data flights$BOM$data flights$DEL$data  # Use with analysis functions fa_summarize_prices(flights) fa_find_best_dates(flights, n = 5)

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: release represents complete redesign package API following Tidyverse conventions consistent fa_ prefixing user-facing functions.

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: Query Creation: - fa_define_query() - Create flight query objects one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain searches - fa_define_query_range() - Create query objects multiple origins dates Data Fetching: - fa_fetch_flights() - Fetch flight data Google Flights using chromote Analysis Functions: - fa_summarize_prices() - Create wide summary table showing prices city/airport date - fa_find_best_dates() - Identify cheapest travel dates across routes

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
code: library(flightanalysis)  # Create a query query <- fa_define_query("JFK", "IST", "2025-12-20", "2025-12-27")  # Fetch flight data result <- fa_fetch_flights(query)  # Analyze results summary <- fa_summarize_prices(result) best <- fa_find_best_dates(result, n = 5)

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
code: # Search multiple origins over a date range queries <- fa_define_query_range(   origin = c("BOM", "DEL", "VNS"),   dest = "JFK",   date_min = "2025-12-18",   date_max = "2026-01-05" )  # Fetch data for each origin for (code in names(queries)) {   queries[[code]] <- fa_fetch_flights(queries[[code]]) }  # Analyze all results summary <- fa_summarize_prices(queries) best_dates <- fa_find_best_dates(queries, n = 10, by = "mean")

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: following functions internal exported: - Flight() - Used internally parsing scraped data - flights_to_dataframe() - Converts flight objects data frames

title: flightanalysis 2.0.0
text: fa_define_query_range.R - Date range query creation fa_summarize_prices.R - Price summary tables fa_find_best_dates.R - Best date identification filter_placeholder_rows.R - Data cleaning helpers scrape.R - Core query fetching functionality Comprehensive examples examples/ directory Full test coverage tests/testthat/ Suggested dependencies: chromote, progress

title: flightanalysis 1.0.0
text: Initial CRAN-ready release Full R package implementation chromote-based scraping Support one-way, round-trip, chain-trip, perfect-chain queries Driver-free browser automation using Chrome DevTools Protocol
